question: Chris goes to the store to buy some sugar. The normal brand of sugar he buys costs $22 per kilogram. He had to buy a more expensive brand that costs 25% more since his favorite brand was sold out. He decides to buy a week's worth of sugar and he uses 1 kilogram of sugar per day. He also decided to buy himself a muffin for $4. How much did everything cost?
answer:
The sugar he bought was 22*0.25=$<<22*0.25=5>>5 more expensive per kilogram than what he normally buys
So it cost 22+5=$<<22+5=27>>27 per kilogram
He goes through 1*7=<<1*7=7>>7 kilograms of sugar a week
So he paid 27.5*7=$<<27.5*7=192>>192 on sugar
That means his total bill was 192+4=$<<192+4=196>>196
#### 196
